questiontext.text:
Find the values of x for which the following matrix has no inverse :

$$\small \begin{pmatrix}-1 &-4 &-2 \\x &2 &2 \\3 &x &-4\end{pmatrix}\:$$

[Express the answers in increasing order such that x1 < x2]

x1 ={1:NUMERICAL:=-6.7016:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}x2 ={1:NUMERICAL:=-0.29844:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

generalfeedback.text:
When a matrix has no inverse, the determinant of the matrix is equal to 0. So,

$$\small \begin{vmatrix}-1 &-4 &-2 \\x &2 &2 \\3 &x &-4\end{vmatrix}\: = 0$$

On solving the determinant we get the following equation :

$$ \small-1((-8) - (2x)) - (-4)((-4x) - (6) + (-2)(x^{2} - (6)) = 0 $$

On simplifying the equation, we get

$$\small-2x^{2}-14x-4 = 0 $$

Solving for x, we get:

$$ \small x_{1} =-6.7016$$
$$\small x_{2} =-0.29844$$

questiontext.text:
Find the values of x for which the following matrix has no inverse :

$$\small \begin{pmatrix}-1 &1 &-4 \\-5 &1 &x \\x &-2 &-1\end{pmatrix}\:$$

[Express the answers in increasing order such that x1 < x2]

x1 ={1:NUMERICAL:=-7:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}x2 ={1:NUMERICAL:=4:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

generalfeedback.text:
When a matrix has no inverse, the determinant of the matrix is equal to 0. So,

$$\small \begin{vmatrix}-1 &1 &-4 \\-5 &1 &x \\x &-2 &-1\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

On solving the determinant we get the following equation :

$$\small-1((-1) - (-2x)) - (1)((5) - x^{2}) + (-4)((10) - (1x)) = 0 $$

On simplifying the equation, we get

$$\smallx^{2}+3x-28 = 0 $$

Solving for x, we get:

$$ \small x_{1} =-7$$
$$\small x_{2} =4$$

$$\small \begin{vmatrix}1 &-1 &-2 \\x &-4 &1 \\1 &x &-3\end{vmatrix}\: = 0$$

On solving the determinant we get the following equation :

$$ \small1((12) - (1x)) - (-1)((-3x) - (1) + (-2)(x^{2} - (-4)) = 0 $$

On simplifying the equation, we get

Solving for x, we get:

questiontext.text:
Find the values of x for which the following matrix has no inverse:

$$\small \begin{pmatrix}-4 &-4 &3 \\-3 &x &1 \\4 &-1 &x\end{pmatrix}\:$$

generalfeedback.text:

$$\small \begin{vmatrix}-4 &-4 &3 \\-3 &x &1 \\4 &-1 &x\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

On solving the determinant we get the following equation :

$$\small-4(x^{2} - (-1)) - (-4)((-3x) - (4)) + (3)((-1) - (4x)) = 0 $$

On simplifying the equation, we get

$$\small-4x^{2}-24x-11 = 0 $$

Solving for x, we get:

$$ \small x_{1} =-5.5$$
$$\small x_{2} =-0.5$$

questiontext.text:
Find the values of x for which the following matrix has no inverse :

$$\small \begin{pmatrix}-2 &-1 &-4 \\x &2 &3 \\-1 &x &-4\end{pmatrix}\:$$

[Express the answers in increasing order such that x1 < x2]

x1 ={1:NUMERICAL:=-1.4271:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}x2 ={1:NUMERICAL:=1.9271:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

generalfeedback.text:
When a matrix has no inverse, the determinant of the matrix is equal to 0. So,

$$\small \begin{vmatrix}-2 &-1 &-4 \\x &2 &3 \\-1 &x &-4\end{vmatrix}\: = 0$$

On solving the determinant we get the following equation :

$$ \small-2((-8) - (3x)) - (-1)((-4x) - (-3) + (-4)(x^{2} - (-2)) = 0 $$

On simplifying the equation, we get

$$\small-4x^{2}+2x+11 = 0 $$

Solving for x, we get:

$$ \small x_{1} =-1.4271$$
$$\small x_{2} =1.9271$$

questiontext.text:

$$\small \begin{pmatrix}-5 &-4 &5 \\x &-2 &1 \\-1 &x &-5\end{pmatrix}\:$$

generalfeedback.text:
When a matrix has no inverse, the determinant of the matrix is equal to 0. So,

$$\small \begin{vmatrix}-5 &-4 &5 \\x &-2 &1 \\-1 &x &-5\end{vmatrix}\: = 0$$

On solving the determinant we get the following equation :

$$ \small-5((10) - (1x)) - (-4)((-5x) - (-1) + (5)(x^{2} - (2)) = 0 $$

On simplifying the equation, we get

$$\small5x^{2}-15x-56 = 0 $$

Solving for x, we get:

$$ \small x_{1} =-2.1674$$
$$\small x_{2} =5.1674$$

$$\small \begin{vmatrix}-4 &-3 &-4 \\-1 &-4 &x \\x &1 &-2\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

On solving the determinant we get the following equation :

$$\small-4((8) - (1x)) - (-3)((2) - x^{2}) + (-4)((-1) - (-4x)) = 0 $$

On simplifying the equation, we get

$$\small \begin{vmatrix}2 &-1 &5 \\-5 &x &-1 \\-5 &-2 &x\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

On solving the determinant we get the following equation :

$$\small2(x^{2} - (2)) - (-1)((-5x) - (5)) + (5)((2) - (-5x)) = 0 $$

On simplifying the equation, we get

$$\small2x^{2}+20x+41 = 0 $$

Solving for x, we get:

$$ \small x_{1} =-7.1213$$
$$\small x_{2} =-2.8787$$

On solving the determinant we get the following equation :

questiontext.text:

$$\small \begin{pmatrix}1 &-1 &-1 \\x &-2 &-2 \\-5 &x &-1\end{pmatrix}\:$$

generalfeedback.text:
When a matrix has no inverse, the determinant of the matrix is equal to 0. So,

$$\small \begin{vmatrix}1 &-1 &-1 \\x &-2 &-2 \\-5 &x &-1\end{vmatrix}\: = 0$$

On solving the determinant we get the following equation :

$$ \small1((2) - (-2x)) - (-1)((-1x) - (10) + (-1)(x^{2} - (10)) = 0 $$

On simplifying the equation, we get

$$\small-x^{2}+x+2 = 0 $$

Solving for x, we get:

$$ \small x_{1} =-1$$
$$\small x_{2} =2$$

On solving the determinant we get the following equation :

$$ \small5((20) - (2x)) - (-4)((-4x) - (4) + (-4)(x^{2} - (-10)) = 0 $$
